subject: Re: [junit] Re: JUnit 4 restructuring
msgSnippet: ... Michael, I really like assertThat.  I ve reimplemented it at least twice to take advantage of generics: public void  assertThat (T obj, Constraint
messageBody:
Michael Herrmann wrote:

> What do you think about Joe Walnes' Flexible JUnit
> assertions<http://64.233.161.104/search?q=cache:k4i4bq5MGYMJ:joe.truemesh.com/blog/000511.html+>(this
> is a link to Google's cache because his site seems to be down at the
> moment) and my
> aproach<http://saloon.javaranch.com/cgi-bin/ubb/ultimatebb.cgi?ubb=get_topic&f=68&t=000944
> <http://saloon.javaranch.com/cgi-bin/ubb/ultimatebb.cgi?ubb=get_topic&f=68&t=000944>>
> ?

Michael,

I really like assertThat. I've reimplemented it at least twice to take
advantage of
generics:

public void <T> assertThat (T obj, Constraint<T> constraint);

That said, it's a little heavy-weight if you want to define many new
constraints, and I still need to find the right balance.

David Saff
